newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares drift, block deals lead actives.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares drift, block deals lead actives.

text.p: Singapore shares kicked off the week with a soft open on Monday amid lethargic year-end volumes, dealers said.
"There is no news in the market. Volume is very, very thin," said a dealer with a local bank.
"The actives are mainly dominated by block deals," he added.
At 0215 GMT, the benchmark Strails Times Industrials Index eased 4.91 points to 2,197.69. Volume was around seven million units, with gainers leading losers by 51 to 39.
Leading the actives was marine logistics group, Labroy Marine, which saw all 750,000 shares crossed at Singapore $1.31 (US$0.94).
Electronics products distributor Flextech Holdings, which was trading at S$1.16, saw 600,000 of its 649,000 shares crossed at S$1.12 and S$1.128.
Multimedia company Creative Technology led gainers, rising S$0.50 to S$13.90 on 19,850 shares. Dealers said the stock was fueled by Wall Street's firm performance last week.
The foreign tranche of Singapore Airlines and Keppel Corp fell S$0.10 each on slim volumes.
